mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Expresses his happiness that Short will soon be living in Washington, D.C. and hopes that Short will spend his meals with Jefferson when possible; received information that Russia has stopped all communication with Great Britain, including recalling the ambassadors; all affairs with the United States and Europe are at an impasse for the time being.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1808 January 31, Washington, [D.C.] to [William] Short, n.p.
